titleStmt.title: The coy shepherdess or, Phillis and Amintas. Fair Phillis in a wanton posture lyes not thinking to be seen by mortall eyes till accidentally Amintas came, and see her lie, which made her blush for shame he cast himself down by her on the hay and won her love, before he went away. Tune of, Phillis on the new made hay, or, Amarillis. J.P.
titleStmt.author: J. P.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for R. Burton at the Horse-shoe in West-smithfield.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Phillis on the new made hay ..."
Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
